result.execSummary:
The defendant Vernon Lavenuel Farr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Vernon Lavenuel Farr is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Vernon Lavenuel Farr was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Habitual Criminality], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Vernon Lavenuel Farr was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes:
03-30-16/ Judge Michelle Ackerman Havas
The Court ordered the JOC shall be amended to state that the defendant is convicted on count one as a repeater under section 939.62(1)(a).
Concurrent with:
Probation Review Hearing scheduled for May 13, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

miscConds.notes: -Pay all MANDATORY costs, assessments, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by Dept of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. ANY CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED.

-No contact with firearms.
-48 USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.

-NO CONTACT with the victim, UNLESS requested by victim and then only with prior approval of agent.
-3rd party contact for the purpose of time with child(ren) as approved by agent.

-Attend and successfully complete Batterers Intervention and continued programming.
-Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
-Parenting classes.
-Attend and successfully complete treatment and counseling programs as deemed appropriate by agent.

timeConds.notes: -Serve 60 days in the House of Correction STAYED pending a review on 5-13-2016 at 1:30pm in Branch 45.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Vernon Lavenuel Farr in court with attorney Virginia m Stuller.  Erika Frank Motsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.
Bail refund
Mailed Bail Refund Notice to Surety.
Reflects 03-30-16 Court order def convicted on Ct 1 as a repeater under sec 939.62(1)(a)
Order Amending Judgment of Conviction, signed and filed.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, the motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Michelle Ackerman Havas, Br. 45, for review. mag
DOC request to clarify repeater statute on count one.

Defendant Vernon Lavenuel Farr in court with attorney Virginia m Stuller.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties and the defendant.

As to Count 1:  The court sentenced the defendant to serve 6 months in the House of Correction, concurrent, with credit for 0 days time served.  The court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on probation with the WI Department of Corrections for a period of 18 months.

As to Count 2:  The court sentenced the defendant to serve 3 months in the House of Correction, concurrent.  The court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on probation with the WI Department of Corrections for a period of 18 months.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-Serve 60 days in the House of Correction STAYED pending a review on 5-13-2016 at 1:30pm in Branch 45.
-Attend and successfully complete Batterers Intervention and continued programming.
-Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
-Parenting classes.
-Attend and successfully complete treatment and counseling programs as deemed appropriate by agent.
-NO CONTACT with the victim, UNLESS requested by victim and then only with prior approval of agent.
-3rd party contact for the purpose of time with child(ren) as approved by agent.
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-No contact with firearms.
-Pay all MANDATORY costs, assessments, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by Dept of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. ANY CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED.
-48 USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.

filed: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.
  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for May 13, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Vernon Lavenuel Farr in court with attorney Virginia m Stuller.  Defendant Vernon Lavenuel Farr in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for jury trial. Defense counsel has another trial pending in another court. State is waiting for the victim to arrive. Case passed. Case recalled.

Court dismissed the REPEATER PENALTY AS TO COUNT 2:

As to Counts 1 & 2:
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing. 


As to Counts 3 & 4:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered Counts 3 & 4 dismissed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 3, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Vernon Lavenuel Farr in court with attorney Frederick F Klimetz.  Defendant Vernon Lavenuel Farr in custody.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Jury Trial. 1st call of the Jury Trial. Parties ready to proceed. Received & Filed, Amended Information and Criminal Complaint. 
Amendments (as to both complaint and information): 
AMENDED Count 1: Misdemeanor Battery, Repeater, Domestic Abuse, contrary to Wis. Stat. 940.19(1). 939.62(1)(a), 968.075(1)a), a class A Misdemeanor.
COUNTS 2 & 3: Remain the same.
ADDED, Count 4: Felony Intimidation of a Victim, Repeater, contrary to Wis. Stat. 940.45(1), 939.62(1)(b), a class G Felony.
Initial Appearance and Arraignment held simultaneously.  Copies given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.

Defendant Vernon Lavenuel Farr in court with attorney Richard L. Voss.  Defendant Vernon Lavenuel Farr in custody.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded. Sworn for the state: Milwaukee Police Officer Shahriar Solati. Defense requests calling a victim as a witness. State objects. Discussions regarding request placed on the record. Court granted defense request. Sworn for defense: Alisha W.  Defense rests. State does not have additional witnesses.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.   Court took judicial notice of certified documents regarding case 01CF5568. Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND. Defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Court granted defense request. Court ordered all motions filed and discovery turned over 20 DAYS prior to Jury Trial. Per Court, the Jury Trial in this matter is to be scheduled for 1:30 pm. Case is adjourned to Branch 23.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for June 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with A.W. and children, including T.A.W.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Vernon Lavenuel Farr in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Defendant Vernon Lavenuel Farr in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defendant enters Not Guilty plea as to Misdemeanor Count 2.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.
